subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanji|grade=c|rs=口04}} <!-- No corresponding kyūjitai character as 吳 (U+5433) lacks JIS support -->

# [[China]]
# to [[give]] something, to [[do]] something for someone

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ご}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ご}} {{m|zh|吳|tr=ngu|pos=name of a state}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} {{zh-l|吳|tr=Wú}}.

subSections.title: Proper noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|proper|ご|kyu=吳}}

# Japanese reading of the Chinese [[surname]] Wu.
# the ancient [[w:Wu (state)|State of Wu]]
# [[China]], [[Chinese]]
#: More commonly found in compounds in modern Japanese.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|くれ}}
The {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|暮れる|tr=kureru||to set (''said of the sun or moon''), to get dark}}, from the way that China lies to the [[west]] of Japan, in the direction of the setting sun.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Originally referred more specifically to the ancient [[w:Wu (state)|State of Wu]] (roughly analogous with the modern [[w:Jiangnan|Jiangnan]] region), and later referring to China as a whole.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

subSections.title: Proper noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|くれ|proper|kyu=吳}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=くれ|archaic}} [[China]], [[Chinese]]
#: More commonly found in compounds in modern Japanese.
# a place name, such as that of [[w:Kure,_Hiroshima|Kure City]] in [[w:Hiroshima_Prefecture|Hiroshima Prefecture]]

subSections.title: Derived terms
